org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.cache
Class InternetAddress

java.lang.Object
  org.phoenixbioinformatics.proxy.cache.InternetAddress
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable<InternetAddress>
public class InternetAddress
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<InternetAddress>

A wrapper class containing an Internet address. The IPv4 address can take two forms, an integer and a four-part dot-separated string. This class lets you convert from one to the other. The IPv6 address uses the Google Code IPv6Address class to represent the address.

Author:
Robert J. Muller

Constructor Detail

InternetAddress

public InternetAddress(java.lang.String ipString)
Create an Internet Address object from a string representation.

Parameters:
ipString - the quad representation of an IPv4 address (nnn.nnn.nnn.nnn) or the hex representation of an IPv6 address (nnn:nnn:nnn:nnn:nnn:nnn:nnn:nnn)

InternetAddress

public InternetAddress(java.lang.Long ip)
Create an Internet Address object from an integer representation (IPv4).

Parameters:
ip - the integer representation of an IP address

equals

public boolean equals(InternetAddress o)
Is this Internet address the same as a specified one?

Parameters:
o - the specified Internet address
Returns:
true if the addresses are the same, false if not

isBetween

public boolean isBetween(InternetAddress start,
                         InternetAddress end)
Is the address between two other Internet addresses, inclusive? If there is a problem with the address range, the method logs the warning and returns false.

Parameters:
start - first Internet address
end - second Internet address, must be greater than the first one
Returns:
true if the current IP address is between start and end inclusive or false if it is not or there is a processing error

isBetween

public boolean isBetween(com.googlecode.ipv6.IPv6AddressRange range)
Is the v6 address in a v6 address range?

Parameters:
range - the v6 address range to check
Returns:
true if the current IP address is in the range, false if not

Returns:
the decimal representation of the IPV4 address

Convert from the internal representation of an IP address to a quad-string representation of an IPv4 address.
